summary: This bill, the Medicaid Third Party Liability Act, aims to clarify and strengthen the rules surrounding third-party liability for medical assistance under Medicaid. It removes certain special treatments, clarifies the roles of health insurers, increases state flexibility in recovering funds from third parties, and mandates the verification of insurance status for Medicaid recipients. Key provisions include amendments to the Social Security Act regarding State contracts with health insurers and the acceptance of State rights of recovery.
